title: How to use Bard's ultimate properly
body:
I've been seeing a lot of Bards try to land their ults on the whole enemy team during a teamfight, and I just wish I took time to tell them how that only works for setting up a Wombo Combo instead of a follow-up.  By using it as a follow-up, the Bard player will likely waste his team's resources for pumping out damage or locking down the enemy team.  

Instead of constantly ulting the entire enemy team, try to ult 2-3 enemy team members, preferably the enemy back line.  What this does is completely cut their damage in half while still allowing your team to fight 5v2 or 5v3. For anyone who has played Starcraft Brood War, the Protoss race has the Arbiter, which has an ability that works just like Bard's ultimate; it was a AoE stasis effect.  Protoss players would use Stasis to freeze the enemy back line, cutting the enemy's damage in half while allowing the player to kill the remaining half with ease.  This same exact concept applies in this situation.  Cut the enemy team's damage potential in half while keeping the remaining members vulnerable.

Alternatively, the ultimate can also be used as an initiation.  The 2.5 second stasis gives ample time for your team to get into position and to follow-up once the enemy team exits stasis.  As the enemy team waits to get out of stasis, your team is ready to knock them up, stun them, and just outright kill them.  However, this does rely on your team having at least a decent timing for when to use their abilities.

Lastly, I would also use this ult to catch someone who is trying to escape.  Did that pesky Katarina/Lee Sin/Kalista/LeBlanc/Teemo get away?  Ult them from 3400 range away and let your teammates catch up to them.

replies.body:
There are tons of uses, not just these two... though OP's suggestions are some of the best. Other uses I've either seen or done myself:

1. Saving an ally/allies from a DoT death/Karthus ult
2. Disabling an enemy tower for a tower dive
3. Stalling a Baron/dragon fight so your jungler has a chance to smite-steal

It's an incredibly powerful move because it's so flexible.
You also forgot ulting your own structure so your team can position to save it

Yes, there are definitely more uses for using Bard's ultimate well, such as disengaging, stalling Baron, deactivating enemy towers, and saving your own towers.  However, the three uses I've given are basics that I believe people should learn first before trying out slightly fancier plays with it.

Yes! It's incredibly flexible. And I still do recommend OP's list. The best uses I've seen by far have been freezing 2 enemies for a couple seconds in a teamfight, and catching fleeing enemies... but I don't want people to forget its other uses... and some of my favorite have been saving a low ally from a Karthus ult.
I know there are situations for everything, but the three uses are the basic ones that I feel people should know first before playing Bard.
Glad to see I'm not the only one who immediately thought "Isn't that just Stasis from Brood War?"
You can also ult as many people as possible on the opposite team in order to easily disengage.
Agreed.  Disengaging is also another useful and easy to learn strategy with Bard's ultimate.

Yes! This.

My favorite way to use it is to ult an enemy and allow my team to get in position to kill them when they try to run

Additional Note:

**IT IS ONLY A GOOD TIME TO ULT AN ALLY WHEN THE ENEMY IS ABOUT TO DEAL DAMAGE THAT CANNOT BE STOPPED IN TIME OR BY ULTING THE ENEMY!**

if my team has Oriana, wukong, and Yasuo, you bet your ass I'm gonna try to ult their whole team. 

I already kind of caught on to this though. Another thing I did that won the team fight was ult their 2 raid bosses before they could help their over extended back line.

I'm not saying it's bad to ult the entire team.  What I am saying is if you want to ult the entire enemy team as Bard, you must either be the very first to ult or the very last to ult on your team.  Ulting in between your teammate's high-impact abilities, like Orianna's, Wukong's, Yasuo's, Malphite's, or Sejuani's ults will mess up the flow of damage as the enemy team may still be locked down, but they will take no further damage while in stasis.

usually it would be better to ult the front line since they tend to be bulkier and take longer to kill off (Mundo, defensive J4, Xin, etc...). The issue I can see being that the back line may use that opportunity to escape. Another good use for Bard ult is to counter engages like if the enemy team has an initiator + Orianna combo, if u time it right u can use the ult to counter both the initiators engage and Orianna ult. U can also use it to set up peel for your carries too since if u ult their assassin and ur adc u have time to get into position to CC the Assassin off of the ADC. Also can hit entire enemy teams or the enemy + objectives to give u a chance to defend. Like if they are on a 5 man mid assault and your team is out of position to defend, ult the tower to prevent them from taking it and the towers behind it (since towers are invulnerable while the ones ahead of them are alive) giving u time to get to the tower to defend it.
You can use it to negate Zed ultimate too. Had a good usage during a zed tower dive that saved a team mate and bought time for the rest of my team to show up and clean house.
What I do, during a team fight, I ult the back so we can melt the front. Or vise vera if I can the front without hitting my front.
Exactly what I am saying to do.  It cuts the enemy team's damage output in half while leaving half of the enemy team to die.
This helps and it's what I try to do too. However, I still think Riot misspelled Bad.
